page.title: 12VILLAGE BLACKSMITH
page.content: Mr John Wilson bought the blacksmiths shop in 1957. It had been a blacksmiths for many years. It was a wooden building bricked around by Mr. Wilson. When the building was completed the wooden building was knocked down. When they first started farm machinery repairs were the main jobs for 8 to 9 workers. Gradually as farmers got their own welding equipment and trained farm employees to weld this type of work has become almost non existant. In recent years they have mostly manufactured machinery for fruit growers. Some machinery is for locals and some for Kent growers. They also distribute their machinery to farmers in France,Belgium,Spain,Portugal and Holland. The firm now employs 2 workers who are Mr Wilson's sons.
